candidates.title: epic: 3.4 - Cancellation of interaction with external systems

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
When the external system performance is poor, it can seriously affect the response performance of the TURN server.

In previous versions, udp used multiple threads to process udp packets at the same time, and when it needed to get a password, it asked the external system for the current user's password via the hooks api. There are some problems with this, if the external system is slow to respond, this will block the current thread's udp packet processing process, although there are multiple threads, but if each thread is waiting, then the server will be stuck, which is unacceptable.

So, in version 3.4, the hooks api was removed, no interaction with the outside is generated, and udp uses a single thread to process messages, which will improve throughput performance most of the time.

At the same time, the driver isn't really necessary, as it's purely an HTTP interface, so there's not much need to have to maintain a driver.

# Change

- Remove the HTTP hooks interface.
- UDP packet processing uses a single thread.
- Events are pushed to the client via SSE.
- Remove the password from the api session information.
- mimalloc went from optional to always used.
- No more separate crates for turn and stun.
- Overall project editor upgrade to 2024.
- Remove the driver.

candidates.title: v3.3.0
candidates.body:
- New test case.
- Fixed incorrect parsing of `RequestedTransport` property.
- Added support for `DontFragment`, `AdditionalAddressFamily`, `RequestedAddressFamily`, `EvenPort` and `ReservationToken` attributes.
- Replaced the `unsafe` implementation of the stun parser with a safe implementation.
- New simpler and faster implementation of turn state management.
- Remove ambiguity in previous turn-rs implementations of `CreatePermission` and `ChannelBind`.
- New external interface that distinguishes between transport protocols and interfaces.

candidates.title: Bump hashbrown from 0.15.0 to 0.15.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

candidates.body:
Bumps [hashbrown](https://github.com/rust-lang/hashbrown) from 0.15.0 to 0.15.2.
Changelog

Sourced from hashbrown's changelog.

[v0.15.2] - 2024-11-14

Added

  • Marked const fn constructors as rustc_const_stable_indirect when built as part of the standard library. (#586)

[v0.15.1] - 2024-11-03

This release removes the borsh feature introduced in 0.15.0 because it was found to be incorrectly implemented. Users should use the hashbrown feature of the borsh crate instead which provides the same trait implementations.

candidates.title: feat: turn rest api rfc support;
candidates.body:
rfc: https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-uberti-behave-turn-rest-00

Although this rfc is not officially supported, everyone basically follows it, so it is still necessary to implement this specification.

candidates.title: epic: v3.0.0-alpha
candidates.body:
* Fallback the grpc interface to http implementation.
* Delete other useless components and only provide basic rust drivers.

chosen_pr.title: epic: 3.4 - Cancellation of interaction with external systems

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

chosen_pr.body:
When the external system performance is poor, it can seriously affect the response performance of the TURN server.

In previous versions, udp used multiple threads to process udp packets at the same time, and when it needed to get a password, it asked the external system for the current user's password via the hooks api. There are some problems with this, if the external system is slow to respond, this will block the current thread's udp packet processing process, although there are multiple threads, but if each thread is waiting, then the server will be stuck, which is unacceptable.

So, in version 3.4, the hooks api was removed, no interaction with the outside is generated, and udp uses a single thread to process messages, which will improve throughput performance most of the time.

At the same time, the driver isn't really necessary, as it's purely an HTTP interface, so there's not much need to have to maintain a driver.

# Change

- Remove the HTTP hooks interface.
- UDP packet processing uses a single thread.
- Events are pushed to the client via SSE.
- Remove the password from the api session information.
- mimalloc went from optional to always used.
- No more separate crates for turn and stun.
- Overall project editor upgrade to 2024.
- Remove the driver.

chosen_detail.title: epic: 3.4 - Cancellation of interaction with external systems
chosen_detail.body:
When the external system performance is poor, it can seriously affect the response performance of the TURN server.

In previous versions, udp used multiple threads to process udp packets at the same time, and when it needed to get a password, it asked the external system for the current user's password via the hooks api. There are some problems with this, if the external system is slow to respond, this will block the current thread's udp packet processing process, although there are multiple threads, but if each thread is waiting, then the server will be stuck, which is unacceptable.

So, in version 3.4, the hooks api was removed, no interaction with the outside is generated, and udp uses a single thread to process messages, which will improve throughput performance most of the time.

At the same time, the driver isn't really necessary, as it's purely an HTTP interface, so there's not much need to have to maintain a driver.

# Change

- Remove the HTTP hooks interface.
- UDP packet processing uses a single thread.
- Events are pushed to the client via SSE.
- Remove the password from the api session information.
- mimalloc went from optional to always used.
- No more separate crates for turn and stun.
- Overall project editor upgrade to 2024.
- Remove the driver.
